shortdesc.p: The transformation from MARC to Linked Art requires that both records and access points within records be modeled and entified in order to create a normalized representation of the data.

topicmeta.shortdesc: The transformation from MARC to Linked Art requires that both records and access points within records be modeled and entified in order to create a normalized representation of the data.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Eleven top-level entities are required for use in LUX.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Eleven top-level entities are required for use in LUX.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Entities that correspond to resources held by the library (books, journals, databases, archival collections, etc.).

topicmeta.shortdesc: Entities that correspond to resources held by the library (books, journals, databases, archival collections, etc.).
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Taxonomy of content types and related formats for classifying record-level resources in LUX.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Taxonomy of content types and related formats for classifying record-level resources in LUX.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Accumulated groups of objects or materials having a focal characteristic and that have been brought together by an individual or organization. A collection comprises multiple items that are conceptually or physically arranged together for the purpose of cataloging or retrieval (AAT).

topicmeta.shortdesc: Accumulated groups of objects or materials having a focal characteristic and that have been brought together by an individual or organization. A collection comprises multiple items that are conceptually or physically arranged together for the purpose of cataloging or retrieval (AAT).
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

p.q: Mixture of various components issued as a unit and intended primarily for instructional purposes. No one component is identifiable as the predominant component of the item.

shortdesc.q: Mixture of various components issued as a unit and intended primarily for instructional purposes. No one component is identifiable as the predominant component of the item.

shortdesc.p: Any materials representing, in whole or part, the earth or any celestial body at any scale.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Any materials representing, in whole or part, the earth or any celestial body at any scale.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Volumes of maps, with or without descriptive text, which may be issued to supplement or accompany texts or be published independently.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Volumes of maps, with or without descriptive text, which may be issued to supplement or accompany texts or be published independently.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Representations of the Earth, heavens, or another planet in the form of a ball.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Representations of the Earth, heavens, or another planet in the form of a ball.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Refers to graphic or photogrammetric representations of the Earth's surface or a part of it, including physical features and political boundaries, where each point corresponds to a geographical or celestial position according to a definite scale or projection. The term may also refer to similar depictions of other planets, suns, other heavenly bodies, or areas of the heavens. Maps are typically depicted on a flat medium, such as on paper, a wall, or a computer screen.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Refers to graphic or photogrammetric representations of the Earth's surface or a part of it, including physical features and political boundaries, where each point corresponds to a geographical or celestial position according to a definite scale or projection. The term may also refer to similar depictions of other planets, suns, other heavenly bodies, or areas of the heavens. Maps are typically depicted on a flat medium, such as on paper, a wall, or a computer screen.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Works in two dimensions or very low relief that were made by gluing paper, fabrics, photographs, or other materials onto a flat surface.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Works in two dimensions or very low relief that were made by gluing paper, fabrics, photographs, or other materials onto a flat surface.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Visual works produced by drawing, typically by the application of lines on a surface, often paper, by using a pencil, pen, chalk, or some other tracing instrument to focus on the delineation of form rather than the application of color.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Visual works produced by drawing, typically by the application of lines on a surface, often paper, by using a pencil, pen, chalk, or some other tracing instrument to focus on the delineation of form rather than the application of color.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Refers to graphic or photogrammetric representations of the Earth's surface or a part of it, including physical features and political boundaries, where each point corresponds to a geographical or celestial position according to a definite scale or projection. The term may also refer to similar depictions of other planets, suns, other heavenly bodies, or areas of the heavens. Maps are typically depicted on a flat medium, such as on paper, a wall, or a computer screen.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Refers to graphic or photogrammetric representations of the Earth's surface or a part of it, including physical features and political boundaries, where each point corresponds to a geographical or celestial position according to a definite scale or projection. The term may also refer to similar depictions of other planets, suns, other heavenly bodies, or areas of the heavens. Maps are typically depicted on a flat medium, such as on paper, a wall, or a computer screen.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Unique works in which images are formed primarily by the direct application of pigments suspended in oil, water, egg yolk, molten wax, or other liquid, arranged in masses of color, onto a generally two-dimensional surface.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Unique works in which images are formed primarily by the direct application of pigments suspended in oil, water, egg yolk, molten wax, or other liquid, arranged in masses of color, onto a generally two-dimensional surface.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Refers to still images produced from radiation-sensitive materials generally by means of the chemical action of light on a sensitive film, paper, glass, or metal.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Refers to still images produced from radiation-sensitive materials generally by means of the chemical action of light on a sensitive film, paper, glass, or metal.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Catch-all category for resources that contain some kind of pictorial content, but a more specific kind cannot be determined from the mapping.

topicmeta.shortdesc: Catch-all category for resources that contain some kind of pictorial content, but a more specific kind cannot be determined from the mapping.
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Notices, usually decorative or pictorial, intended to be posted to advertise, promote, or publicize an activity, cause, product, or service; also, decorative, mass-produced prints intended for hanging. For small printed notices or advertisements intended for distribution by hand, use "handbills."

topicmeta.shortdesc: Notices, usually decorative or pictorial, intended to be posted to advertise, promote, or publicize an activity, cause, product, or service; also, decorative, mass-produced prints intended for hanging. For small printed notices or advertisements intended for distribution by hand, use "handbills."
topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Pictorial works produced by transferring images by means of a matrix such as a plate, block, or screen, using any of various printing processes.

tt434

shortdesc.p: An image on film or glass, usually positive, intended to be viewed by means of light passing through the image.

topicmeta.author: timothy.thompson@yale.edu
tt434

shortdesc.p: Three-dimensional items not covered by more specific terms (e.g., clothing, stitchery, fabrics, tools, utensils), and naturally occurring objects.

shortdesc.p: Works published in pieces over time, typically at regular intervals.

shortdesc.p: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is a publisher-assigned commercial book identifier that is intended to be unique. May appear in 10- or 13-digit formats.
